page.title: 02WEETING VILLAGE 1
page.content: The village is split by the B1106, the Brandon-Stoke Ferry road going N.S., and a minor road on the alignment of the Old Drove Road (Hockwold to Roud- ham Heath).The latter becomes a foot- path only through part of the village so motorists have to drive round three sides of a rectangle to regain the alignment. The one public house and only garage which also sells cars are on the B1106 and 4 of the shops are near there on a broad concrete road left over from the 2nd World War.The fifth shop is a gen- eral store and Post Office at the cross roads of the B1106 and the Drove Road.The shops include a D.I.Y.cum garden centre and a small haberdashers the other two shops are grocery stores.
